Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Cyprus High School

Granite School District, Magna, Utah

Principal: Stephen K. Hess

Cyprus High School's Website

About Cyprus High School

School background
Cyprus High School’s long-standing tradition of excellence dates back to April of 1918, when Cyprus High School first opened it’s doors. The auditorium was added in 1974 and the science building in 1978. Due to the age of the main building, it was completely rebuilt in 1984. We are proud to have many distinguished leaders in business and government among our alumni.

All students that live within two miles of the school walk to school. Granite School District provides buses for those who live further than two miles from school.

Cyprus High School has 70 classrooms and 6 relocatable classrooms.

Enrollment
Cyprus High School serves approximately 1,602 students in three grades, 10th, 11th and 12th. Caucasian 66.6%
Hispanic 25.34%
Pacific Islander 3.06%
Asian 1.75%
American Indlan 1.62%
African American 1.56%
Unknown .06%

Computers and Technology
Cyprus High School has seven computer labs, using the most updated equipment. These labs are available for students for regular class work, remedial and Honors and Advanced Placement programs. Our media facility is fully automated and has two computer labs.

Principal
Stephen K. Hess

School Calendar
Traditional 9 month

Lunch hour
1st lunch 10:35 - 11:05
2nd lunch 12:00 – 12:30

Registration
Registration is conducted on-line, mail- or bring-in from mid-July to mid-August.

School motto
"Cyprus High School - Home of Scholars and Champions"

Extracurricular programs
Cyprus is a member of Region 6, a 5-A classification school. We participate competitively in the following programs: Baseball, Basketball, Cross-Country, Drama, Drill Team, Football, Boys and Girls Golf, Instrumental Music, Vocal Music, Boys and Girls Soccer, Softball, Swimming, Boys and Girls Tennis, Boys and Girls Track and Field, Volleyball and Wrestling.
